page.title: 11Information systems, Salem
page.content: -A monthly mobile library serves Salem and district. Daily newspapers are delivered by the postman, Sunday papers by Rutland House Newsagents, in Llandeilo. Local news is passed by "word of mouth"-80 yr-old May "Plough" Thomas is the central and most well- informed person in Salem. Generally the local news is received by her first, either from the postman who calls on her most days, or from her very frequent visitors. {Communications}-1 public telephone box (red ) by Troedyrhiw, telephones in most homes. Sub post Office, Golwg y Gar, letter box outside;2 collections, 1 delivery weekdays. Letter boxes also by Taliaris Park and Tynewydd, Capel Isaac. {Social concerns} -There are a few very active members of the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament living locally.
